BONUS: INCLUDES AN INTERVIEW WITH THE AUTHOR

Maya is hiding in plain sight in London. The twenty-six-year-old has 
abandoned the dangerous obligations pressed upon her by her father, and 
chosen instead to live a normal life. But Maya comes from a long line of 
people who call themselves Harlequins?a fierce group of warriors willing to 
sacrifice their lives to protect a select few known as Travelers.

Gabriel and Michael Corrigan are brothers living in Los Angeles. Since 
childhood, the young men have been shaped by stories that their late father 
was a Traveler, one of a small band of prophets who have vastly influenced 
the course of history. Travelers are able to attain pure enlightenment, and 
have for centuries ushered change into the world. Gabriel and Michael, who 
may have inherited their father&#039;s gifts, have always protected themselves by 
living "off the Grid"?that is, invisible to the real-life surveillance networks 
that monitor people in our modern society.

Summoned by her ailing father, Maya is told of the existence of the brothers. 
The Corrigans are in severe danger, stalked by powerful men known as the 
Tabula. As Maya races to California to protect the brothers, she is reluctantly 
pulled back into the cold and solitary Harlequin existence. A colossal battle 
looms?one that will reveal not only the identities of Gabriel and Michael 
Corrigan but also a secret history of our time.

----

John Twelve Hawks lives off the Grid.

----

Actor and writed Scott Brick has performed on film, television, and radio. His 
stage appearances throughout the United States include Cyrano, Hamlet, 
and Macbeth.
